intro: Iris persica var. issica, commonly known as the Persian iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features upright, sword-shaped leaves and produces striking blue to purple flowers with a distinctive three-dimensional structure. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and blooms in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and elegant form.
